ಒತ್ತಾಗು ottāgu to be crowded; to be dense; 2. to stand in support of; to buttress; ಒತ್ತಿಗೆ ಹಾಕು ottige hāku to stock or deposit (fruits) under hay to help ripening fast; ಒತ್ತೊತ್ತೆ ottotte the state of being crowded or dense; ಒತ್ತೊತ್ತೆಯಾಗು ottotteyāgu to crowd; to assemble at a place.
a percussion instrument from which sound is produced by pressing it hard.
a ring of metal, leather, rubber, etc. used to lock another ring, nut in a place; a guard-ring.
a compelling influence; a constraining force; forceful persuasion; compulsion.
a thick, soft, absorbent paper used to dry a surface that has just been written on in ink; blotting paper.

to give emphasis to; to give special force, prominence to; to stress; to emphasise.
to give an abutment as a support.
to write the symbol of a consonant or consonants, below the first one, in a compound of consonants.
a young demon which is supposed to prevent a person sleeping under the roof-beam of the house, from breathing by squeezing the throat.
a hard, thick, painful growth of skin, esp. on a toe, caused by pressure or friction; a corn.
a structure of wood, stone or brick built against a wall to strengthen or support it; a buttress; a prop; an abutment.
a piece of stone that causes a painful dent on the sole of the bottom of the foot when stepped on it.
a stone pillar bearing the burden from below.
a man who moves an object from one place to another; a mover.
a button having two parts that fastens two ends of a cloth when pressed together; a press -button.
a knob which, when pressed, puts on or cuts off an electric current, as for bells, etc.; a push-button.
a ring of small height kept around the mortar to prevent grains jumping out or away when pounded.

to hide oneself behind (something).

a projecting support built on to the outside of a wall; a buttress.
a flat metal plate, as that in a printing press which presses the paper against the inked type; the platen of a printing machine.
to come as a support, buttress.
the finger nearest to the thumb; the index finger; the forefinger.
a fence around a town.

a thick fence.

a machine for printing from inked type, plates or rolls; a printing press.
an artificially ripened fruit.

that which is taken, occupied by trespassing, intruding; encroachment.
to go along with or by the side of.
to be encroached.
a food made from the flour paste or dough pressed into thin strings through a small mortar that has holes, and cooked.
the act of pressing; compression.
a covering fastened under the rafters of a roof.
a sour caused by tight-cloth, esp. round the waist; a pressure-sore.

he who encroaches others land illegally.

money paid to a prostitute for having sexual intercourse with her.
a deposit the interest earned on which is earmarked for a particular use.
food etc. put on a hook or trap to lure animals or fish; a bait;

a man who is alone; a lonely man.
to pay money to a prostitute.

to seize; to take possession of.
to become seized, occupied.

any of the oils used to anoint the body with.

a piece of land that is pledged.
a person in feudal servitude, bound to his master's land and transferred with it to a new owner; a serf.
a person given as a pledge or taken prisoner as by an enemy or terrorist, until certain conditions are met; a hostage.
